channel.title: Best choice?
channel.description:
Basically I've just bought a new capture card for recording whatever is on T.V be it XBox gameplay, DVDs, VHS etc. My TV has [b]no[/b] TV Output, so I was thinking of buying one of the SCART to PHONO Input/Output switches as a makeshift TV Output.
http://www.maplin.co.uk/Module.aspx?ModuleNo=13372
Do you think that will work if I just plug it into a spare dock, switch it to ouput and then plug in my spare RCA cable?

item.title: Best choice?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Your TV isn’t going to have a TV output, the things you hook up to your TV have the output. If they have two outputs (like most DVD players and such) then hook one to the TV and one to your capture card. If they only have one output, get splitters from radio shack to hook it up.

Solved the problem (Gave my dad my TV for his [His has T.V Output on it]).

Read full topic
